Examples | Special Topics | Resources | Home

Reproducibility Resources & Tools

Methods

  • Bio-Protocol: A peer-reviewed protocol journal; free to read & publish
  • protocols.io​: an open access repository of science methods; free to read & publish

Reagents

  • Addgene​: nonprofit plasmid repository
  • CiteAb​: antibody search engine with results sorted by citations
  • Quartzy​: manage lab inventory

Data

  • DataDryad​: curated digital repository; free to access, $120 to publish dataset up to 20GB
  • Figshare​: free digital repository, 5GB per file limit
  • Zenodo​: free digital repository; 50GB per dataset limit

Statistical Analysis

  • Handbook of Biological Statistics
  • Stats in Biology and its R implementation
  • Lecture on stats in python using scipy​
  • Stats in python
  • Nature Stats for Biologist resources

Electronic Lab Notebooks (ELN)

  • Best practices & support services for research data lifecycles: Harvard University
  • Benchling​(free)
  • Open Science Framework​(free)
  • sciNote​(open source, free)
  • Evernote​(free and $)
  • Labguru​($)

Code

  • Github:​ code repository; free for public repos
  • Jupyter Notebooks​: open source web-app for creating & sharing live code, equations, and more
  • Code Ocean​: computational reproducibility platform; free to upload, share & publish executable code with DOI; pay for more computing time over freemium limit
  • Conda and BioConda: A operating system independent package environment manager for the command line
  • Docker and Biocontainers​: A container ecosystem to package code and data on the command line
  • Binder: A tool to make your github repository an online docker image run in the cloud
  • Galaxy​:​ A web and graphic interface based bioinformatics platform. Needs local set-up for larger data handling.

Data Management

  • Best practices & support services for research data lifecycles: Harvard University
  • Short primer on data storage and handling: Kbroman Lab
  • ​Short primer on data management and file naming conventions: Purdue Library
  • Detailed resource on how to handle data throughout its life-cycle: Dataone
  • Free online course for those who handle digital data: Mantra

Data Visualization

Beyond Bar Graphs: Free Tools & Resources for Creating More Transparent Figures

  • Small Datasets
  • Interactive Dotplot Tool ​
  • Interactive Linegraph Tool​
  • Other free tools
  • R Tutorial
    • Plotting in R
    • Customized interactive visualizations (Shiny)
    • ggplot2
    • Claus Wilke blog post on Fundamentals of Data Visualization
  • Python
    • Collection of useful resources
    • Data Carpentry: An Introduction to Python for Data Analysis and Visualization
    • PyCon 2016 Tutorial
    • PyData Packages ​ (incl. Matplotlib, Seaborn, Numpy, Pandas, and many more important for data analysis and visualization)
Supported by ASPB, Addgene, Protocol.io, eLife and CodeOcean
